{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient is a 3-week-old male newborn with inward turning of his left forefoot. The examination shows concavity of the medial border of the foot with a skin crease just below the ball of the great toe and convexity of the lateral border. Tickling the lateral border leads to correction of the deformity. X-ray reveals an increased angle between the 1st and 2nd metatarsal bones. This is consistent with clubfoot, which is often caused by oligohydramnios during pregnancy. The next step in management would be to apply a foot abduction brace to correct the deformity.", "answer_choice": "A"}
